section.section: Within 12 hours after initial confinement of an individual to any facility or a Veterans' Administration hospital, the form provided for in this section shall be read and given to the individual.

If the individual does not understand the notice required by this section and its legal effect, the notice also shall be given to:
The parent, guardian, or next of kin of the individual;
The applicant for an involuntary admission of the individual; and
Any other individual who has a significant interest in the status of the individual.
In any event, if possible, notice of the admission shall be given to the parent, guardian, or next of kin of the individual. Notice of the admission of a minor shall be given as promptly as possible.

text.section: The form shall be read in English or, if the individual does not understand English, in the language or manner best calculated to inform the individual of the applicable provisions of the law.
The facility shall keep in the individual's records a copy of the form and a certification of the administrative head of the facility as to the compliance with this section.

Notice under this section shall be given again to an individual when:
A new application is made under this subtitle for a voluntary admission; and
New certificates are made under this subtitle for an involuntary admission.
